item.title: New York State Senate passes prohibitions on non-competes
item.description: - The New York State Senate has approved two bills that could ban or limit the use of non-compete agreements in the state.

item.title: I booted Linux 293k times in 21 hours
item.description: - A bug in Linux 6.4 causes it to hang on boot, but only in about 1 in 1000 boots.

item.title: The Reddit blackout will continue
item.description: - Reddit has announced a policy change that will affect third-party Reddit apps, leaving only the official mobile app as an option.

item.title: First people sickened by Covid-19 were scientists at WIV: US government sources
item.description: - Evidence suggests that the first people to be infected with COVID-19 were Chinese scientists at the Wuhan Institute of Virology (WIV).

item.title: Bay Area woman is on a crusade to prove Yelp reviews can't be trusted
The Reddit blackout has left Google barren & full of holes
item.description: - Over 8,000 subreddits have gone offline in protest of Reddit's upcoming API changes, leading to a significant impact on Google search results.

item.title: Native JSON Output from GPT-4
item.description: - OpenAI has released a new feature called function calling for their GPT models, which allows them to call a function and return JSON data instead of just a string.

item.title: Reddit Doubles Down
item.description: - Reddit is facing backlash from users and moderators over plans to charge developers to use its API, potentially impacting third-party clients and network enhancements.

item.title: Always the same warning signs
item.description: - Laronde, a biotech firm, has faced major problems reproducing data that helped raise them hundreds of millions of dollars last year.

item.title: Serotonin booster leads to increased functional brain connectivity
item.description: - A new study published in Biological Psychiatry: Cognitive Neuroscience and Neuroimaging examines the effects of a serotonin booster called prucalopride on the brain.
